alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 8:37PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette, southwestern Marshall, eastern Tate and northeastern Panola Counties through 900 PM CST... At 836 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sardis, or near John W Kyle State Park, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Como, Barr, Harmontown, Laws Hill, Abbeville, Wakefield, Blackwater, Teckville, Looxahoma, Aiken, Wyatte, Crossroad, Tyro, Chulahoma, Glenville, Thyatira, Hayes Crossing and Bett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
